definition: neck/collar/to lead/to receive/classifier for clothes, mats, screens etc

sentences.english: It would be nice if all three of us make the podium.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们三个都能登上领奖台那将是很有意思的事。

sentences.english: To stand on that make-shift podium constructed from milk crates and old school doors.
sentences.chinese: 为了站在那个由奶XXX和旧的校门筑成的领奖台上。

sentences.english: Group Vice President Kim Tae-Beijing to accept the award on behalf of group companies.
sentences.chinese: 集团公司副总经理金太代表集团公司进京领奖。

sentences.english: He was so excited that his eyes filled with tears when he stepped up to the platform.
sentences.chinese: 登上领奖台的那一刻，他激动得两眼潮润。

sentences.english: Flew back from atourney in Spain for that one.
sentences.chinese: 为了领奖，我从西班牙的联赛飞了回去。

sentences.english: We need to have some consistency and more podiums if possible.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须要保持稳定，如果可能更多上领奖台。

sentences.english: The key to getting on the podium was the start.
sentences.chinese: 今天登上领奖台的关键是起步。

sentences.english: To get on the stage for the award is something we don't know in advance.
sentences.chinese: 事先我们是不知道自己会上台去领奖的。

sentences.english: Finally, I succeeded, standing in the symbolic glorious podium.
sentences.chinese: 最终，我成功了，我站在了那象征光荣的领奖台上。

sentences.english: He moved forward to accept the award.
His parents flushed with pride when he went to receive his prize.
sentences.chinese: 当他去领奖时，他的父母自豪得满面红光。

sentences.english: I step forward to receive my prize.
First person, over-excited, shock to the hospital first aid and can not accept the award.
sentences.chinese: 第一名的人，兴奋过头，休克送医院急救，无法领奖。

sentences.english: The crowd cheered as the movie star went up to receive his prize.
sentences.chinese: 当影星上台领奖时，人群欢呼起来。

sentences.english: But they don't actually stand on the podium grinning.
sentences.chinese: 但站在领奖台上，他们没有微笑。

sentences.english: The sportswoman who got the second place in judo refused to accept the medal.
sentences.chinese: 在柔道比赛中获得第二名的女运动员拒绝领奖。

definition: to win a prize/a successful gamble
